heading: Line Fence Disputes
text: The provincial Line Fences Act provides a process for you to resolve line fence disputes with your neighbours. It applies when you want to build, repair, or maintain a fence on your shared property line, but you cannot agree on the type of fence you should use and / or how to split the costs. A line fence shows where one person's land ends and a neighbour's land begins.

heading: Dealing with neighbour fence disputes
text: Before you begin an arbitration process, you should talk to your neighbours to try and reach an agreement. If you cannot agree, you can request the presence of a fence viewer to help resolve the dispute. According to the Line Fences Act, you can involve fence viewers in only two situations: Note: Fence viewers cannot help you with disputes if construction has already started or if there is a disagreement about where the property line is located. The dispute resolution process requires three fence viewers, and each one must receive a daily remuneration. Fence viewings cannot take place during the winter, between November 1 of one year and March 31 of the following year. You may wish to seek legal advice concerning any legal remedy you may have against the adjoining property owner.

heading: How to apply for a fence viewer
text: By Mail By Email Once the City Clerk receives your application and the required fee, we will schedule a date and time for the arbitration hearing. The City Clerk and the fence viewers will notify all property owners at least one week before the hearing.
